channel.title: [Help] Gnoppix
channel.description:
Can anyone help me install gnoppix, i burned it to cd and when it ran i got an error i asked for help on linuxforums.com and they said:
--------------
Did you do a md5sum checksum on the downloaded iso for data integrity?
http://www.linuxiso.org/viewdoc.php/verifyiso.html
--------------
Anyways i don't know how to do this, i read the info on the site and it dident work, (well for me anyway) another person told me you don't need to do it so now i'm really confused, so can someone please tell me how i should do it :)
Edit: The gnoppix website is here:
http://www.gnoppix.org/

item.title: [Help] Gnoppix
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

what did you use to burn the iso to the cd? did you use something that actually makes it a runnable disc or is it just a data disc with the iso on it so you can put it on other computers?

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Gnoppix
item.dc:creator: @htideswell htideswell
item.description:
@htideswell wrote:

well i just burnt the iso to the cd

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Gnoppix
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

You dont need to check the MD5 hash of it. Have you burnt the image of the cd properly, not just copied the iso file onto it? Could you please be a bit specific as to what error you are getting when you try to boot from it?

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Gnoppix

item.description:
@htideswell wrote:

Can anyone help me install gnoppix, i burned it to cd and when it ran i got an error i asked for help on linuxforums.com and they said:

Did you do a md5sum checksum on the downloaded iso for data integrity?

http://www.linuxiso.org/viewdoc.php/verifyiso.html

Anyways i don't know how to do this, i read the info on the site and it dident work, (well for me anyway) another person told me you don't need to do it so now i'm really confused, so can someone please tell me how i should do it
